chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall n m p : nat, n >= m -> p + n >= p + m

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
NatAux.mult_ge_compat_rev_l : forall n m p : nat, p * n >= p * m -> 0 < p -> n >= m
NatAux.mult_ge_compat_l : forall n m p : nat, n >= m -> p * n >= p * m
Nat.le_trans : forall n m p : nat, n <= m -> m <= p -> n <= p
NatAux.mult_lt_compat_l : forall n m p : nat, n < m -> 0 < p -> p * n < p * m
mult_le_compat_l : forall n m p : nat, n <= m -> p * n <= p * m
Init.Nat.mul = fix mul (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S p => m + mul p m end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.mul (_ _)%nat_scope
ge_dec : forall n m : nat, {n >= m} + {~ n >= m}
inj_ge : forall n m : nat, n >= m -> (Z.of_nat n >= Z.of_nat m)%Z
ge_Nge : forall n m : nat, (N.of_nat n >= N.of_nat m)%N -> n >= m
le_ge_dec : forall n m : nat, {n <= m} + {n >= m}
not_lt : forall n m : nat, ~ n < m -> n >= m
not_ge : forall n m : nat, ~ n >= m -> n < m
Nat2Z.inj_ge : forall n m : nat, n >= m < -> (Z.of_nat n >= Z.of_nat m)%Z
Nge_ge : forall n m : N, N.to_nat n >= N.to_nat m -> (n >= m)%N
Pos.peano_ind : forall P : positive -> Prop, P 1%positive -> (forall p : positive, P p -> P (Pos.succ p)) -> forall p : positive, P p
BinNatDef.N.add = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => m | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => n | N.pos q => N.pos (p + q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments BinNatDef.N.add (_ _)%N_scope
Init.Nat.add = fix add (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S p => S (add p m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.add (_ _)%nat_scope
growing_prop : forall (Un : nat -> R) (n m : nat), Un_growing Un -> n >= m -> (Un n >= Un m)%R
RingMicromega.ge_bool_cases : forall n m : nat, if RingMicromega.ge_bool n m then n >= m else n < m
IZR_ge : forall n m : Z, (n >= m)%Z -> (IZR n >= IZR m)%R
nat_compare_ge : forall n m : nat, n >= m < -> (n ?= m) <> Lt
nat_of_P_lt_Lt_compare_complement_morphism : forall p q : positive, Pos.to_nat p < Pos.to_nat q -> Pos.compare_cont Eq p q = Lt
nat_of_P_lt_Lt_compare_morphism : forall p q : positive, Pos.compare_cont Eq p q = Lt -> Pos.to_nat p < Pos.to_nat q
Cauchy_crit = fun Un : nat -> R => forall eps : R, (eps > 0)%R -> exists N : nat, forall n m : nat, n >= N -> m >= N -> (R_dist (Un n) (Un m) < eps)%R : (nat -> R) -> Prop Arguments Cauchy_crit _%function_scope
dec_ge : forall n m : nat, Decidable.decidable (n >= m)

```coq
intros n m p H.
apply Nat.le_ge_dec in H.
destruct H as [H | H].
- apply Nat.le_trans with (p + m).
  + apply le_plus_l.
  + apply plus_le_compat_l.
    assumption.
- exfalso.
  apply not_ge in H.
  apply lt_plus_minus in H.
  apply Nat.lt_asym in H.
  assumption.
Qed.
```

original: intros n m p H. apply Nat.le_ge_dec in H. destruct H as [H | H]. - apply Nat.le_trans with (p + m). + apply le_plus_l. + apply plus_le_compat_l. auto. - exfalso. apply not_ge in H. apply lt_plus_minus in H. apply Nat.lt_asym in H. auto.
